text:
Since the age of ten, I am passionate about computer graphics. At the time, I just  had discovered youtube and the video game called "Minecraft". A lot of content creators had a introduction at the beginning of the video to identify themselve and something just clicked in my head, I wanted to do that.
In 2010 or so, technical tutorials were not as common as today, and there were few really qualified people to teach about complex software as 3d softwares. But with some work and exploration of all the content that I could find at the time, I downloaded a software called "Cinema 4d" which is still an industry standard today, and starded doing my on youtube introduction on the family computer.
My 3d render were bad at the time because of my limited knowledge, I'll also admit that about 75% of my creations were only me following tutorials but I was proud of myself and for a ten years old boy it was ok. Moreover, even with great knowledge, the raw performances of a family computer was not enough to do high quality stuff, but the creative process around it hooked me into computer graphics.
After that period, I went in my teenager era if I can say so, I had far less learning and creation done but I was the "graphic designer" of my friend.
The next part in my journey toward computer graphics is far more recent, just before going to college, we need to ask us about what we will be doing in the futur and the idea of computer graphic resurfaced like something obvious in my head. Since then I work every month or so on computer graphics software, for personnal project or for student association lately.
Nowadays it is far easier to learn about 3d software, there are more an more profesionnal courses that you can access online for free and the community is always here to help if you have any trouble. One of thing that helped is that a lot is a software called blender, it is free and opensource, so everyone can do his own thing done with it. Since it is very popular it is almost be concidered as a standard in the field, it is not really used in the industry because it is a general software and the industry tends to used specialized software to do really specific tasks but it can do a lot of thing greatly ! For example one of the episode of the serie "love, death, robot" on netflix was made using only blender.
However, my professionnal project evolved through the years, I joined ESIR because of the digital imaging specialization with the idea work in the field but with no clear idea of what I'll do later. As of today, I'm realy interested in special effects from the movie and it is my aiming point but I am more and more interested in AI generated art which is kiind of the revolution.
